intro: Claytonia mexicana, commonly known as Mexican spring beauty, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, bell-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun to partial shade. Its leaves are fleshy and succulent, adapted to store water in arid environments. Claytonia mexicana is often found in open woodlands and along stream banks, where it contributes to local biodiversity.
